poem:
**Eyeliner Epiphany**

In the mirror's wink, a cat-eye dream,  
where liquid streaks chase fleeting precision,  
a steady hand or whimsical scheme—  
the ritual flirts with demolition.  
A fluke's allure in kohl-kissed foam,  
a hasty swipe, an unformed home,  
our eyes are scripts of day's incursion,  
each line a winged, imperfect version.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Eyeliners: 10 of the best Even after years of mainlining eyeliner – kohl, gel, liquid, numerous colours – I’d be lying if I said I was an expert. Sometimes I am very happy with how it turns out – a fluke, always a fluke – and other times it goes so horribly wrong I literally have to start over. And if pressed for time – which is usually the case – I forgo the whole". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Eyeliners: 10 of the best Even after years of mainlining eyeliner – kohl, gel, liquid, numerous colours – I’d be lying if I said I was an expert. Sometimes I am very happy with how it turns out – a fluke, always a fluke – and other times it goes so horribly wrong I literally have to start over. And if pressed for time – which is usually the case – I forgo the whole
